sources.title: The Tomb of Ligeia (1964)
sources.description: The Tomb of Ligeia is a 1964 American-British horror film directed by Roger Corman. Starring Vincent Price and Elizabeth Shepherd.Â  It follows Verden Fell, a widower haunted by the spirit of his deceased wife, Ligeia. After marrying Rowena, a young woman who resembles Ligeia, Fell struggles with his past as Ligeia's spirit, possibly inhabiting a black cat, threatens their new life, leading to a dramatic confrontation that results in tragedy for all involved.

metadata.Plot: Some years after having buried his beloved wife Ligea, Verden Fell meets and eventually marries the lovely Lady Rowena. Fell is something of a recluse, living in a small part of a now ruined Abbey with his manservant Kenrick as the only other occupant. He remains infatuated with his late wife and is convinced that she will return to him. While all goes well when first married, he returns to his odd behavior when they return to the Abbey from their honeymoon. The memories of Ligea continue to haunt him as well as her promise that she would never die.
metadata.Writer: Edgar Allan Poe, Robert Towne, Paul Mayersberg
metadata.Actors: Vincent Price, Elizabeth Shepherd, John Westbrook
